oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grass cover retained by nose-ringing of outdoor sows only partially reduces the risk of N leaching
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eriksen, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nutrient turnover
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nose-ringing is an option to maintain grass cover in outdoor pig production systems. However ringing is no guarantee for a low environmental load. Management choices in terms of feeding, animal density and nutrient distribution are at least as important in order to obtain a low nutrient loss potential.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Eriksen, J. (2005) Grass cover retained by nose-ringing of outdoor sows only partially reduces the risk of N leaching. DARCOFenews (3).
